Inference: Rain detections occurring during low humidity indicate the onset of sudden rainfall events
Description: Low humidity followed by rain detection suggests abrupt storm fronts where rain rapidly increases atmospheric moisture.
short rationale: Abrupt rain in dry air; weather-only, no personal detail.

Inference: Rain detections occurring during high humidity indicate saturated atmospheric conditions
Description: High humidity often precedes rainfall, so detection during these periods reflects moisture-rich air transitioning into rain.
short rationale: Moist air transitioning to rain; climate signal only.

Inference: Rain detections during temperature drops indicate cold-front rainfall
Description: Rainfall commonly cools the surrounding air, making temperature drops a typical precursor or response to rain events.
short rationale: Cooling rain front; environmental pattern only.

Inference: Rain detections during temperature spikes indicate warm-season rainfall or convective storms

short rationale: Hot-season/convective rain clue; weather only.

short rationale: Pre-rain saturation cue; no behavioral data.
